task_description: Facing the building to your West (approx. 275°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full building from base to roofline to estimate height, so I should tilt the camera upward while keeping the same heading.
I’m no longer facing west toward the target building, so I should rotate left to heading 270° to re-align with the building while staying pitched up to capture its top.
To estimate the building’s height I need to see its roofline clearly, so I should tilt up while staying aimed west at the facade.
The view snapped back to north again, so I must rotate to 270° west while keeping the upward pitch to keep the building’s top in frame.
I need both the base and roofline for a height estimate, so I should step back to widen the view while still oriented toward the building.
I’m now facing roughly north, so I should rotate left to about 280° to face the target building to the west again.
With the building centered again, I should tilt upward to capture the roof and upper floors to gauge total height.
The view reset to north again, so I need to rotate back to 270° west to put the target building in view.
I likely need a stable view including both ground and roof, so rather than tilting up again I should keep pitch level and estimate by visible stories from this wider position.
